thread.title: Marquee matchups headline South Carroll's 52-15 win over Marriotts Ridge wrestling
thread.title_full: Marquee matchups headline South Carroll's 52-15 win over Marriotts Ridge wrestling

author: Tim Schwartz
title: Marquee matchups headline South Carroll's 52-15 win over Marriotts Ridge wrestling
text:
News Maryland Howard County Howard County Sports Marquee matchups headline South Carroll's 52-15 win over Marriotts Ridge wrestling 
Wrestling meet between Marriotts Ridge and South Carroll at Marriotts Ridge High School. Marquee matchups headline South Carroll's 52-15 win over Marriotts Ridge wrestling. (Photos by Doug Kapustin) Caption Glenelg wrestling beats Mt. Hebron, 51-18 
Highlights from Glenelg's 51-18 win over Mt. Hebron on Jan. 17, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Highlights from Glenelg's 51-18 win over Mt. Hebron on Jan. 17, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) Caption Glenelg wrestling beats Mt. Hebron, 51-18 
Highlights from Glenelg's 51-18 win over Mt. Hebron on Jan. 17, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Highlights from Glenelg's 51-18 win over Mt. Hebron on Jan. 17, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) Caption Franklin vs. Lansdowne wrestling 
Franklin's Jahki Hylton talks about Indians' 43 27 win over Lansdowne. (Craig Clary/BSMG) 
Franklin's Jahki Hylton talks about Indians' 43 27 win over Lansdowne. (Craig Clary/BSMG) Caption Mount Saint Joseph wrestling beats McDonogh, 35-14 
Highlights from No. 1 Mount Saint Joseph's 35-14 win over No. 3 McDonogh on Wednesday, Jan. 11, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Highlights from No. 1 Mount Saint Joseph's 35-14 win over No. 3 McDonogh on Wednesday, Jan. 11, 2017. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) Caption Glenelg wrestling beats Oakland Mills, 37-32 
Highlights from Glenelg's 37-32 win at Oakland Mills on Jan. 3, 2016. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Highlights from Glenelg's 37-32 win at Oakland Mills on Jan. 3, 2016. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) Caption 2016 Mount Mat Madness wrestling tournament 
Highlights from the 2016 Mount Mat Madness wrestling tournament Dec. 30 at Mount Saint Joseph High School in Baltimore. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Highlights from the 2016 Mount Mat Madness wrestling tournament Dec. 30 at Mount Saint Joseph High School in Baltimore. (Tim Schwartz/Baltimore Sun video) 
Spano managed to get behind Crawford late in the standing position, but the Cavaliers wrestler scrambled his way to the mat with a Peterson roll and ended up on top with a takedown with 28 seconds remaining. Crawford held Spano down the rest of the way to win a 4-3 decision and remain undefeated on the season at 38-0. 
It’s the second straight defeat for Spano (29-2), who won 74 straight matches from the 2015 state tournament until Jan. 21. 
“I came in knowing he was a state champ, but I knew I had to wrestle him like he was another wrestler. I knew I had to go in and not think about who he was and wrestle like how I wrestle and wrestle to win,” said Crawford, who finished second at the MIS tournament last year competing for McDonogh. “I knew I had to get the takedown to win and he was stopping my under hooks and Russian ties ... I just went for it and got into a Peterson and then rode him out. Leading into states I knew I had to win this match because I’ll probably have to wrestle him again. A win here will help me keep my head up and go in strong.” 
South Carroll (24-3) led 33-0 after seven matches that included a 24-second pin from two-time state champion Joey Thomas (126) and a 25-8 technical fall victory from two-time state titlist Jamar Williams (170). Aside from Bohan, Marriotts Ridge (13-6) got victories from Troy Grandstaff (182), who received a forfeit, and Joey Naidu (220), who won by fall in 27 seconds. 
Hamper said his team learned some lessons Saturday and that they still need to improve in order to capture their fourth straight state tournament championship. 
“Marriotts Ridge is a good top team and they rode us a little more than I’d like, so we have to work on getting our from the bottom,” he said. “But for the most part our guys battled hard and we’re where we need to be at this point of the season. Are we at our best? No, but we’re peaking toward the end of the year to be there.” 
South Carroll (24-3) — 52, Marriotts Ridge (13-6) — 15 
126: Joey Thomas (SC) pinned Colin Wiggins (MR), 0:24 [6-0] 
132: Cam Werner (SC) dec. Brett Gladstone (MR), 8-5 [9-0] 
138: Steven Dahl (SC) major dec. Jake Fratta (MR), 16-7 [13-0] 
145: Tyler Harbrson (SC) pinned Brandon Citrano (MR), 1:12 [19-0] 
152: Jake MacKenzie (SC) dec. Justin Hooper (MR), 14-12 [22-0] 
160: Joey Judson (SC) pinned Austin Cestone (MR), 0:45 [28-0] 
170: Jamar Williams (SC) tech fall Colin McMurtray (MR), 25-8 [33-0] 
182: Troy Grandstaff (MR) fft. [33-6] 
195: Matt Staley (SC) pinned Tommy Phipps (MR), 5:00 [39-6] 
220: Joey Naidu (MR) pinned Ritchie Summerland (SC), 0:27 [39-12] 
285: Pat Quinn (SC) pinned Tyler Vandenberg (MR), 3:06 [45-12] 
106: Ethan Bohan (MR) dec. Jagger Clapsadle (SC), 5-4 [45-15] 
113: Dakota Bowers (SC) major dec. Will Vaxmonsky (MR), 9-0 [49-15] 
120: Travis Crawford (SC) dec. Chris Spano (MR), 4-3 [52-15]
